title: JSK Herman
text:
Hi there! Welcome to my weblog. 👋
I’m Je Sian Keith Herman. This is the place where I share my thoughts, tools, interests, projects, showcases, experiences, etc. I am currently a 4th year student at Bicol University studying Chemical Engineering and unconfirmed impostor (sus).
I like coding and writing on the side1 when I have free time. My blog is one source where you can find most of my up-to-date written content.
On an unrelated note, I like iced tea 🍹, iced coffee ☕, and ice cream 🍨 in no particular order.

title: Impossible List
text: “The Impossible List™ is NOT a bucket list… This list of impossible things contains all the things I ever thought I couldn’t do because it was ‘impossible’…”1 “…Put simply, the Impossible List™ is an ever-evolving list of experiences that build upon each other, help others as well as yourself, and implore you to take action…”21 Source: IMPOSSIBLE®2 Source: College Info Geek

title: Impossible List
text:
Last 5 Achievements

[[2022-08-06]] Achievement: “We’re in the Nationals” — Join a national competition.
[[2022-07-07]] Achievement: “Budding Tourist” — See and go to another country.
[[2022-07-07]] Achievement: “Cloud Nine” — Ride an airplane.
[[2022-07-07]] Achievement: “On the World Stage” — Join an international competition.3
[[2020-02-02]] Achievement: “Web Surfer to Creator” — Publish a website.

3 Rode on an Airbus A330 with Cebu Pacific Airlines on a round-trip flight from Manila, Philippines to Bangkok, Thailand in order to compete in the SCG Bangkok Business Challenge @ Sasin 2022

title: Activity Log
text:
1013H Had an idea while in the bathroom to start a new activity log (which is this one) to keep myself from drifting off into all sorts of tangents and rabbit holes of thoughts and research.





2201H Moved my impossible list from the other website to this and actually plotted a set of steps for my financial goals with a geometric series with a ratio of \(r = 1.25\). I feel that having that kind of progression is easy enough to be motivated as well as be challenging enough to be interesting.

My first name “Je Sian Keith” is pronounced as /ʤi ʃan kiːθ/ (ji shan kith).
